label: ArtifactExistence.ArtifactFailure
definition: The physical failure of any mechanical artifact
template: <arg1> mechanical artifact failed due to <arg2> instrument at <arg3> place

label: ArtifactExistence.DamageDestroy
definition: The damaging or destruction of a thing
template: <arg1> damaged or destroyed <arg2> using <arg3> instrument in <arg4> place

label: ArtifactExistence.Shortage
definition: Explicit mentions of a shortage of some thing or things (on any scale)
template: <arg1> experienced a shortage of <arg2> supply at <arg3> place

label: Conflict.Attack
definition: An attack event||An attack event, a violent physical act causing harm or damage
template: <arg1> attacked <arg2> using <arg3> at <arg4> place

label: Conflict.Coup
definition: Explicit mentions of any attempt to overthrow the government or government leader, including on-going and attempted coups in addition to completed coups
template: <arg1> was deposed by <arg2> at <arg3> place

label: Conflict.Demonstrate
definition: A demonstration event||A demonstration, march, protest, or political gathering
template: <arg1> was in a demonstration at <arg2> place||<arg1> was in a demonstration for <arg4> topic with <arg3> visual display against <arg5> at <arg6> place, with potential involvement of <arg2> police or military

label: Conflict.Yield
definition: Yield in a battle or attack
template: <arg1> yielded to <arg2> at <arg3> place

label: Contact.Collaborate
definition: A collaboration via communication between two or more arguments, where the context does not distinguish whether the communication is in person or remot
template: <arg1> communicated with <arg2> at <arg3> place

label: Contact.CommandOrder
definition: A command or order expressed in communication, where the context does not distinguish whether the communication is one-way or two-way, or whether it is in person or remote
template: <arg1> communicated with <arg2> at <arg3> place

label: Contact.CommitmentPromiseExpressIntent
definition: A commitment, promise, or intent expressed in communication, where the context does not distinguish whether the communication is one-way or two-way, or whether it is in person or remote
template: <arg1> communicated with <arg2> at <arg3> place

label: Contact.Discussion
definition: A two- or multi-way discussion, where the context does not distinguish whether the communication is in person or remote
template: <arg1> communicated with <arg2> at <arg3> place

label: Contact.FuneralVigil
definition: A funeral, vigil, or memorial event, where the context does not distinguish whether the communication is in person or remote
template: <arg1> communicated with <arg2> during a funeral or vigil for <arg3> at <arg4> place

label: Contact.MediaStatement
definition: A public statement made in communication through the media, where the context does not distinguish whether the communication is one-way or two-way
template: <arg1> communicated with <arg2> at <arg3> place

label: Contact.Negotiate
definition: A statement of negotiation, where the context does not distinguish whether the communication is one-way or two-way, or whether it is in person or remote
template: <arg1> communicated with <arg2> at <arg3> place

label: Contact.Prevarication
definition: A communication that is knowingly untrue or vague about the truth, where the context does not distinguish whether the communication is one-way or two-way, or whether it is in person or remote||Any communication over any medium where the communicator intentionally deceives the addressee or continue an ongoing deception, either by knowingly conveying false information, or conveying information with the intent of the addressee drawing the wrong conclusion, or omitting information.
template: <arg1> communicated with <arg2> at <arg3> place||<arg1> communicated with <arg2> about <arg3> topic at <arg4> place (document does not specify in person or not, or one-way or not)

label: Contact.PublicStatementInPerson
definition: A public statement made in person, where the context does not distinguish whether the communication is one-way or two-way
template: <arg1> communicated with <arg2> at <arg3> place

label: Contact.RequestAdvise
definition: A statement offering advice or making an appeal, where the context does not distinguish whether the communication is one-way or two-way, or whether it is in person or remote
template: <arg1> communicated with <arg2> at <arg3> place

label: Contact.ThreatenCoerce
definition: A statement offering threat or coercion, where the context does not distinguish whether the communication is one-way or two-way, or whether it is in person or remote
template: <arg1> communicated with <arg2> at <arg3> place||<arg1> communicated with <arg2> about <arg3> topic at <arg4> place (document does not specify in person or not, or one-way or not)

label: Disaster.AccidentCrash
definition: Vehicular accident, or the crashing of any type of vehicle
template: <arg1> person in <arg2> vehicle crashed into <arg3> at <arg4> place

label: Disaster.DiseaseOutbreak
definition: Explicit mentions of an outbreak of a disease in an area, region, or country
template: <arg1> disease broke out among <arg2> victims or population at <arg3> place

label: Disaster.FireExplosion
definition: A damaging fire or explosion, either natural or caused||A damaging fire or explosion, either natural or caused but without the intent of attacking
template: <arg1> caught fire or exploded from <arg2> instrument at <arg3> place

label: GenericCrime.GenericCrime
definition: For use as the crime argument in a Justice event when the crime event is not otherwise taggable in the annotation ontology
template: <arg1> committed a crime against <arg2> at <arg3> place

label: Government.Agreements
definition: An agreement between governments or GPEs
template: <arg1> and <arg2> signed an agreement in <arg3> place

label: Government.Convene
definition: Convening an official government body
template: <arg1> convened <arg2> at <arg3> place

label: Government.Formation
definition: The formation of a GPE
template: <arg1> was formed by <arg2> in <arg3> place

label: Government.Legislate
definition: Enacting legislation or other actions of a legislative body, such as votes and legislative activities within a congress or parliament
template: <arg1> legislature enacted <arg2> law in <arg3> place

label: Government.Spy
definition: Government spying activities, espionage activities by actors who are spying on behalf of a government or on behalf of a side that is acting as a government
template: <arg1> spied on <arg2> to the benefit of <arg3> in <arg4> place

label: Government.Vote
definition: A voting event by the people for government activities
template: <arg1> voted for <arg2> on <arg3> ballot with <arg4> results in <arg5> place

label: Inspection.SensoryObserve
definition: An observation or inspection event, where the target of inspection is unspecified
template: <arg1> observed <arg2> in <arg3> place

label: Inspection.TargetAimAt
definition: Explicit mention of physically targeting something, for example aiming at something that may become the target of a Conflict.Attack event
template: <arg1> physically targeted <arg2> with <arg3> instrument at <arg4> place

label: Justice.ArrestJailDetain
definition: The detention, taking hostage, kidnapping, arrest, or jailing of an individual by government or non-government actors.||The detention, taking hostage, kidnapping, arrest, or jailing of an individual by government or non-government actors
template: <arg1> arrested or jailed <arg2> for <arg3> crime at <arg4> place

label: Justice.InitiateJudicialProcess
definition: The initiation of a judicial process by a government actor
template: <arg1> initiated judicial process pertaining to <arg2> before <arg3> court or judge for <arg4> crime in <arg5> place

label: Justice.Investigate
definition: Legal, journalistic, and other investigations
template: <arg1> investigated <arg2> in <arg3> place

label: Justice.JudicialConsequences
definition: The consequences of judicial proceedings
template: <arg1> court or judge decided consequences of <arg3> crime, committed by <arg2>, in <arg4> place

label: Life.Die
definition: The death of a person||The death of a person or animal
template: <arg1> died at <arg2> place||<arg1> died at <arg2> place from <arg4> medical issue, killed by <arg3> killer

label: Life.Injure
definition: The injuring of a person||The physical injuring of a person or animal
template: <arg1> was injured by <arg2> at <arg3> place||<arg1> was injured by <arg2> using <arg3> in <arg4> body part with <arg5> medical issue at <arg6> place

label: Manufacture.Artifact
definition: The building, manufacturing, or creation of an artifact or intellectual property, where the context does not distinguish between building and manufacturing, or between physical artifact and intellectual property
template: <arg1> manufactured or created or produced <arg2> using <arg3> at <arg4> place

label: Medical.Intervention
definition: Any kind of medical treatment or intervention||Any kind of medical treatment or intervention for a person or an animal, often following a diagnosis of a medical condition
template: <arg1> treater treated <arg2> patient for <arg3> medical issue with <arg4> means at <arg5> place

label: Movement.TransportArtifact
definition: The transportation of an artifact, where the context does not distinguish the nature of the movement
template: <arg1> transported <arg2> in <arg3> from <arg4> place to <arg5> place

label: Movement.TransportPerson
definition: The movement or transportation of a person, where the context does not distinguish the nature of the movement
template: <arg1> transported <arg2> in <arg3> from <arg4> place to <arg5> place

label: Personnel.Elect
definition: An election event for a person to begin a new elected position||Government or organization approved process for electing officials (not appointments)
template: <arg1> elected <arg2> in <arg3> place||<arg1> elected <arg2> to <arg3> position in <arg4> place

label: Personnel.EndPosition
definition: A person stopping working in a position||A person stopping working in a position, with no indication that they are changing positions within the same organization
template: <arg1> stopped working at <arg2> in <arg3> place||<arg1> stopped working in <arg3> position at <arg2> organization in <arg4> place

label: Personnel.StartPosition
definition: A person starting working in a position||A person starting working in a position, with no indication that they are changing positions within the same organization
template: <arg1> started working at <arg2> in <arg3> place||<arg1> started working in <arg3> position at <arg2> organization in <arg4> place

label: Transaction.Transaction
definition: A transaction transferring money, ownership, or control of territory, where the context does not distinguish the nature of the transaction
template: A transaction occurred between <arg1> and <arg2> for the benefit of <arg3> at <arg4> place

label: Transaction.TransferMoney
definition: A transaction transferring money, where the context does not distinguish the nature of the transaction
template: <arg1> gave <arg4> money to <arg2> for the benefit of <arg3> at <arg5> place

label: Transaction.TransferOwnership
definition: A transaction transferring ownership, where the context does not distinguish the nature of the transaction
template: <arg1> gave <arg4> to <arg2> for the benefit of <arg3> at <arg5> place

label: ArtifactExistence.DamageDestroyDisableDismantle
definition: The damaging or destruction of a thing
template: <arg1> damaged or destroyed <arg2> using <arg3> instrument in <arg4> place

label: ArtifactExistence.ManufactureAssemble
definition: Physical action of building, assembling, manufacturing, putting things together, mixing, etc. (does not include the creation of intellectual property)
template: <arg1> manufactured or assembled or produced <arg2> from <arg3> components using <arg4> at <arg5> place

label: Cognitive.IdentifyCategorize
definition: The act of establishing the identity of an entity or event, or establishing the relevant category that an entity or event belongs to, such as being a suspect or a target or an attack
template: <arg1> identified <arg2> as <arg3> at <arg4> place

label: Cognitive.Research
definition: Explicit mention of researching the answer to a question by analyzing literature or testing hypotheses through experiments or reviewing opinions from experts in a field
template: <arg1> researched <arg2> subject using <arg3> at <arg4> place

label: Cognitive.TeachingTrainingLearning
definition: The action of teaching a person or animal a particular skill or type of behavior, where the learner does not have complete mastery of the skill until the end
template: <arg1> taught <arg2> field of knowledge to <arg3> using <arg4> at <arg5> institution in <arg6> place

label: Conflict.Defeat
definition: Defeat in a conflict or an election, but not a game-style competition
template: <arg1> defeated <arg2> in <arg3> conflict at <arg4> place

label: Contact.Contact
definition: An event where two or more participants communicate over any medium, where the context does not distinguish the nature of the contact or whether the communication is in person or remote
template: <arg1> communicated with <arg2> about <arg3> topic at <arg4> place (document does not specify in person or not, or one-way or not)

label: Contact.Request
definition: A statement making a request or appeal, where the context does not distinguish whether the communication is one-way or two-way, or whether it is in person or remote
template: <arg1> communicated with <arg2> about <arg3> topic at <arg4> place (document does not specify in person or not, or one-way or not)

label: Control.ImpedeInterfereWith
definition: Explicit mention of an entity knowingly placing obstacles, not necessarily physical, that raise difficulties with respect to the occurrence of a taggable, non-Movement event or process
template: <arg1> impeded or interfered with <arg2> event at <arg3> place

label: Disaster.Crash
definition: Vehicular collision or the crashing of any type of vehicle
template: <arg1> person in <arg2> vehicle crashed into <arg3> at <arg4> place

label: Justice.Acquit
definition: An acquit event occurs whenever a trial ends but fails to produce a conviction, including cases where the charges are dropped by the prosecutor
template: <arg1> court or judge acquitted <arg2> of <arg3> crime in <arg4> place

label: Justice.ChargeIndict
definition: A government actor charging, accusing, or indicting a person, organization, or GPE of a crime
template: <arg1> charged or indicted <arg2> before <arg3> court or judge for <arg4> crime in <arg5> place

label: Justice.Convict
definition: A person, organization or GPE entity is convicted whenever that entity has been found guilty of a crime
template: <arg1> court or judge convicted <arg2> of <arg3> crime in <arg4> place

label: Justice.InvestigateCrime
definition: Legal, journalistic, and other investigations of crimes
template: <arg1> investigated <arg2> for <arg3> crime in <arg4> place

label: Justice.ReleaseParole
definition: A release-parole event occurs whenever a state actor (GPE, organization subpart, or person representative) ends its custody of a person entity because the sentence has ended, because the charges are dropped, or because parole has been granted
template: <arg1> court or judge released or paroled <arg2> from <arg3> crime in <arg4> place

label: Justice.Sentence
definition: A sentence event takes place whenever the punishment, particularly incarceration, for the defendant of a trial event is issued by a state actor
template: <arg1> court or judge sentenced <arg2> for <arg3> crime to <arg4> sentence in <arg5> place

label: Justice.TrialHearing
definition: A trial event occurs whenever a court proceeding has been initiated for the purposes of determining the guilt or innocence of a person, organization or GPE accused of committing a crime. A hearing event occurs whenever a state actor (GPE, organization subpart, or person representative) officially gathers to discuss some criminal legal matter.
template: <arg1> tried <arg2> before <arg3> court or judge for <arg4> crime in <arg5> place

label: Life.Consume
definition: An person or animal takes a substance into their body
template: <arg1> consumed <arg2> at <arg3> place

label: Life.Illness
definition: A person or animal experiencing physical harm due to sickness or illness
template: <arg1> has <arg3> sickness or illness at <arg4> place, deliberately infected by <arg2>

label: Life.Infect
definition: A person or animal is infected with a pathogen
template: <arg1> was infected with <arg2> from <arg3> at <arg4> place

label: Medical.Diagnosis
definition: A determination of the disease or medical condition that explains a person's or animal's symptoms and signs
template: <arg1> treater diagnosed <arg2> patient with <arg3> symptom for <arg4> medical issue at <arg5> place

label: Medical.Vaccinate
definition: A person or an animal is inoculated against a disease
template: <arg1> treater vaccinated <arg2> patient via <arg4> vaccination method for <arg3> medical issue at <arg5> place

label: Movement.Transportation
definition: Physical movement or transportation of a person or artifact between places, includes putting and placing objects in locations
template: <arg1> transported <arg2> in <arg3> from <arg4> place to <arg5> place

label: Personnel.ChangePosition
definition: A person changing from one position to another in the same organization, with no indication of relative levels of the positions
template: <arg1> changed working positions at <arg2> organization from <arg3> old position to <arg4> new position  in <arg5> place

label: Transaction.AidBetweenGovernments
definition: A voluntary transfer of resources from one GPE to another from the perspective of governments, often with strings attached
template: <arg1> government gave <arg4> aid to <arg2> government for the benefit of <arg3> at <arg5> place

label: Transaction.Donation
definition: The voluntary provision, donation, or extension of material aid in the form of assets or commodities (nb: use AidBetweenGovernments instead for GPE to GPE donations)
template: <arg1> gave <arg4> to <arg2> for the benefit of <arg3> at <arg5> place

label: Transaction.ExchangeBuySell
definition: A transaction transferring or obtaining money, ownership, possession, or control of something, applicable to any type, nature, or method of acquisition including barter
template: <arg1> bought, sold, or traded <arg3> to <arg2> in exchange for <arg4> for the benefit of <arg5> at <arg6> place

label: Vote.Vote
definition: Casting a vote in a voting process of any kind in any situation
template: <arg1> voted for <arg2> on <arg3> ballot with <arg4> results in <arg5> place
